intro: Peucedanum caspicum, commonly known as the Caspian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hollow stems and fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
